definition: see 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
man
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: The struggle between Chu State and Han State lasted for eight years, yet he eventually failed.
sentences.chinese: 然而項羽卻是個例外，楚漢相爭八年，他最終失敗了。

definition: to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)

using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness

to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
